title: Simple Sentence Structures and Basic Grammar CAT
description: This Continuous Assessment Test evaluates understanding of Ekegusii simple sentence structures, nouns, pronouns, adjectives, and related grammar concepts.

questions.question: [Nouns Part 01 & 02] Which of the following regions is associated with older, more conservative Ekegusii vocabulary such as Chitaratara, Ekemoni, and Omoro?
[Nouns Part 01 & 02] What is the correct provenance term for a person from Bobasi?
[Nouns Part 01 & 02] Identify the pair in which both Ekegusii nouns are classified as impersonal.
[Nouns Part 01 & 02] In Ekegusii, what does the prefix “oyo” signify when used in a noun like oyo Bogirango?
options: A group or people from Bogirango

questions.question: [Nouns Part 01 & 02] Which set best reflects external, visible parts of the body in Ekegusii?
[Nouns Part 01 & 02] What is the correct Ekegusii translation of “The sun rises from the East”?
[Nouns Part 01 & 02] In Ekegusii, which of the following terms is associated with abstract concepts rather than physical objects?
[Nouns Part 01 & 02] Which directional expression correctly shows movement toward the South in Ekegusii?
[Nouns Part 01 & 02] Which of the following pairs both represent abstract nouns in Ekegusii?
[Nouns Part 01 & 02] What is the plural form of the Egesusu word Egesusu (rabbit), according to its noun class pattern?
[Nouns Part 01 & 02] Which of the following animals is classified as a wild animal and not a domestic or poultry animal in Ekegusii?
[Nouns Part 01 & 02] The noun Egioto (frog) belongs to which pluralization class based on suffix patterns?
[Nouns Part 01 & 02] Which of the following traditional Ekegusii vegetables is noted for having mild toxicity and thus requires caution when cooking?
[Nouns Part 01 & 02] Which set correctly lists nouns that would follow the Omo → Ama pluralization pattern in Ekegusii?
[Nouns Part 01 & 02] According to Ekegusii noun pluralization, what is the correct plural form of Riuga (bone)?
[Nouns Part 01 & 02] Which Abagusii traditional dish is made from smoked or sun-dried beef and is known for requiring no refrigeration?
[Pronouns Part 01] Which Ekegusii demonstrative pronoun specifically indicates an object located far from both the speaker and listener?
[Pronouns Part 01] In the sentence "Kera omonto ngoragera", what linguistic feature is emphasized?
[Pronouns Part 01] What is the correct plural demonstrative pronoun for referring to items near the listener?
[Pronouns Part 01] Which of the following uses a possessive suffix exclusive to second person plural?
[Pronouns Part 01] What is the meaning of the expression "Amaene endara yarietu"?
options: All the food was eaten, absolutely
Nothing was left on the plate

questions.question: [Pronouns Part 01] Which form correctly translates “their garden” in Ekegusii using the ‘Egeticha’ construction?
[Pronouns Part 01] In which example is the demonstrative combined with a possessive pronoun?
[Pronouns Part 01] Which interrogative pronoun would best fit in the sentence: “_____ Genda inka?” (____ is going home?)
[Pronouns Part 01] What is the correct translation of “endani” based on the section on specific demonstrative nouns?
[Pronouns Part 01] Which personal pronoun is correctly matched with its plural English equivalent?
[Pronouns Part 01] How would one express “Mogaka’s child” using proper possessive grammar?
[Pronouns Part 01] Which of the following best exemplifies the distributive use for things?
[Pronouns Part 01] Which example demonstrates an emphatic subject pronoun?
[Pronouns Part 02 & Adjectives] Which of the following Ekegusii interrogatives would be most appropriate when asking about the cause of an event rather than the manner of it?
[Pronouns Part 02 & Adjectives] In Ekegusii, how would you form a tag question that conveys polite doubt after saying “You’re going”?
[Pronouns Part 02 & Adjectives] Which of the following transformations is incorrect when forming the genitive (possessive) form?
[Pronouns Part 02 & Adjectives] What is the plural possessive form for “our lands” in Ekegusii?
[Pronouns Part 02 & Adjectives] Which phrase best demonstrates an interrogative used to inquire about time of occurrence?
[Pronouns Part 02 & Adjectives] In Ekegusii noun declension, which grammatical case is the only one that results in morphological changes to the noun?
[Pronouns Part 02 & Adjectives] Which of the following noun-to-possessive transformations shows both root change and suffix addition?
[Pronouns Part 02 & Adjectives] Which adjective type in Ekegusii would the phrase “whose chair?” fall under?
[Pronouns Part 02 & Adjectives] What is the most likely explanation for the genitive transformation “Chinyanya” → “Amatunda”?
options: Prefix change to show indirect object

questions.question: [Pronouns Part 02 & Adjectives] Which of the following best represents a consonant-based genitive transformation?
[Pronouns Part 02 & Adjectives] Which sentence demonstrates an advanced interrogative structure that involves possibility or capability?
